snippet: Competition for space on West 32nd Street between Broadway and Fifth has been so fierce that ground-floor retail rents can easily be more than twice what they are on nearby side streets.
abstract: Competition for space on West 32nd Street between Broadway and Fifth Avenue in New York City's Koreatown has been so fierce that ground-floor retail rents can easily be more than twice what they are nearby; street has become a destination for immigrants hungry for a taste of home, as well as for curious foodies.
lead_paragraph: Competition for space on West 32nd Street between Broadway and Fifth has been so fierce that ground-floor retail rents can easily be more than twice what they are on nearby side streets.

headline.main: Gritty Koreatown Block Turns Hot With a Taste of Home
headline.print_headline: Gritty Koreatown Block Turns Hot With a Taste of Home
